oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Marbro Drive-In promotion - Country Music Month - 1969 - WMTS
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an advertisement for Marbro Drive-In Theater, located in Murfreesboro, Tenn. for a free country music movie night promotion for Country Music Month 1969, broadcast on WMTS (Murfreesboro, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ron Nelson of WTMS radio talks about Country Music Month and Marbro Drive-In's special showings of country music related cinema -- (00:51) Half As Much (Hank William) [recorded excerpt] -- (01:20) Welcome To My World (Jim Reeves) [recorded excerpt] -- (01:45) Nelson describes two other country music movies, and advertises a free family moving night -- (02:25) Nelson talks about "Your Cheatin' Heart" following the life of Hank Williams, and introduces the cast and OST artists -- (03:00) Your Cheatin' Heart (Hank Williams) [recorded excerpt] -- (05:35) Nelson talks about the Marbro Drive-In snack bar -- (06:28) Nelson talks about Jim Reeves starring in "Kimberley Jim" and OST artists -- Kimberley Jim (Jim Reeves) [recorded excerpt] -- (08:56) Nelson talks about the other two movies on display, including "Country Music Caravan" starring Marty Robbins and Minnie Pearl, and "Forty Acre Feud" starring Ferlin Husky -- (09:25) Nelson advertises October 15 as the free country music night at the Marbro Drive-In theater as a contribution to country music month
